want but it's got more than any desktop environment has it's got everything yeah fair enough and
sometimes that's a downside and also i'm aware that i have you know five years worth of experience
with it so of course i'm going to lean towards preferring the thing that's familiar right that
i have in mind as well but you know you have sort of convinced me that you've been happier with
gnome more now than ever yeah yeah i have yeah that's sort of why i leaned towards using the
fedora implementation was that you seem really happy with it you did hesitate with like wanting
to give me the the pre-setup version which is sort of what pop pop is doing and what you know ubuntu
is doing uh i just went crazy and figured okay well i'm just gonna try it just the way it is
because i want to see it from the ground up and that i did that i did yeah i wonder if you saw
my setup what you'd think of it you might soon yeah you will yeah i'm curious what what you're
gonna throw in the dev one for me yeah well oh we have we have a little something to start with
i had that usb here today
this should be entertaining so i think we have a whole episode dedicated to these shenanigans is
that how it's going

episode.title: Brent's Bug Battle | LINUX Unplugged 475
episode.description: Brent has been on a bug-finding marathon. We review what he's discovered and share some hard-learned lessons.
episode.content:
Brent has been on a bug-finding marathon. We review what he's discovered and share some hard-learned lessons.
